settings.goToNewDomain: We are changing the WeekToDo website to a new domain and this one will be discontinued on April 1st 2022. In order to keep your data, you must export it from this domain and then import it in the new domain (From the configuration menu). Keep in mind that if you do not migrate data, you will lose the information your browser stores in this domain. Sorry for any inconvenience this may cause.
settings.clearDataDetails: Are you sure you want to delete all app data? This action is irreversible.
settings.runInBackgroundInfo:
Allows notifications to work with the app closed. 
 This option may have issues for some macOS versions.

donate.mainMessage: WeektoDo is a completely free application supported by the contribution of its users. If you enjoy WeekToDo consider supporting the project with whatever contribution you wish. Thanks for using WeekToDo!

about.desc: WeekToDo is a Minimalist Weekly Planner focused on privacy.

generatedData.data4: Mouse over to display the rest of the text for this task.
generatedData.data5: You can drag and drop the tasks
generatedData.data7: You can create new lists from the side bar
generatedData.data8: You can also hide them in the settings menu
generatedData.data11: Click the three dots for see more details about this task
generatedData.data12: Open task details quickly with the middle mouse click
generatedData.desc1: Here you can set your notes about this task. Double click to edit the notes.

tips.tip1: You can create a new task by clicking on any area of ​​the lists.
tips.tip2: Tasks can be dragged and dropped from one list to another or by changing their order.
tips.tip3: To edit the name of a list or a task, double click on it.
tips.tip4: To the right of the date of each list is the Snooze icon which allows you to send all the pending tasks of the current list to the next day.
tips.tip5: If you are not going to use the custom lists, you can hide them in the configuration menu.
tips.tip6: The calendar in the sidebar allows you to quickly scroll to a date.
tips.tip7: By placing the cursor on the name of the list, the Mark All icon will appear, this allows you to mark all the tasks that a list contains.
tips.tip8: You can create a new custom list using the Add New List button located on the side panel.
tips.tip9: The Start button places you on the current day.
tips.tip13: WeekToDo stores the information on your computer. If you want to change your computer or browser, remember to create a backup. You can do it in the settings menu.
tips.tip14: Click and drag the central division to resize the height of the calendar and the custom lists. Double click on it to restore the size.
tips.tip15: You can modify the number of columns and the zoom of the application in the configuration panel.
tips.tip16: Click the three dots in the tasks to see details.
tips.tip17: You can drag and drop the sub task in the task details window.
tips.tip18: In the top of the task details window you can change the day or the list of a task.
tips.tip10: Productivity: Try to define the fewest possible tasks per day and order them according to their priority.
tips.tip11: Productivity: Review and organize your to-do list for the week at the beginning and end of your day.
tips.tip12: Productivity: Do not plan many things in advance, organize yourself one day at a time. If you have tasks to do move them to for the next day.

welcome.allReadyText: Everything is ready so you can enjoy WeekTodo.
welcome.allReadySub: If you have any questions you can find tips in the sidebar
welcome.welcomeText: The Minimalist Weekly Task Manager focused on privacy. To start select your language.
welcome.privacyText: WeekToDo stores the information on your computer. If you eventually want to change your computer or browser, remember to create a backup.
welcome.privacySub: You can create a backup in the settings menu.
welcome.themeText: You can select between light and dark theme according to your preference.

ui.rmListConfirm: Are you sure you want to delete the list
ui.mobileWarning: WeekToDo is a Desktop application and for now it is not ready to be displayed in this resolution. :(
ui.compatible: Sorry, WeekToDo is not compatible with your web browser. Try to update it or use another one.

notifications.noPendingTasksToday: You have no scheduled tasks today.
notifications.pendingTasksYesterdayAndToday: You have {0} pending tasks yesterday and {1} scheduled tasks today.
